content: Dr Wenjie Ruan HOME About Me News Lab Members RESEARCH Publications Presentations Professional  Services TEACHING Teaching Admin Roles Dr Wenjie Ruan Dr Wenjie Ruan Senior Lecturer in Data Science Department of Computer Science College of Engineering, Mathematics and Physical Sciences University of Exeter (a Russell Group university) Office: K1, Innovation Centre Streatham Campus, University of Exeter Exeter EX4 4RN, UK Email: w.ruan AT exeter.ac.uk Recruitment: I will no longer accept any UG/PGT project students due to the job change. Short Bio Currently, I am a Senior Lecturer in Data Science (~Associate Professor in US system) in the College of Engineering, Mathematics and Physical Sciences at University of Exeter, UK. I am also the Co-Lead of Trustworthy AI Theme, at IDSAI. Before my current position, I was a Lecturer in the School of Computing and Communications, Lancaster University. Before that, funded by the EPSRC Project - Mobile Robotics: Enabling a Pervasive Technology of the Future, I had worked as a Postdoctoral Researcher with Prof. Marta Kwiatkowska in the Department of Computer Science at University of Oxford for two years. I received my Ph.D. degree from the School of Computer Science at University of Adelaide, Australia. During my PhD, I did a six-month research intern in IoT Tech Center (GreenOrbs), Tsinghua University. Before my PhD, I was a Control System Engineer in Institutes of Optics and Electronics, Chinese Academy of Sciences. My current research interests lie in: (1) Robustness, Safety and Interpretability of Deep Learning Models; (2) Interpretable Machine Learning and Its Applications in Health Data Analytics and Human-Centred Computing. AELARS Jan/2021: Invited to give a half-day tutorial “Towards Robust Deep Learning Models: Verification, Falsification, and Rectification” in IJCAI 2021, with colleagues from Liverpool University and Imperial College London Oct/2020: A Postdoctoral Research Fellow position now is available, anyone interested is welcome to apply. Oct/2020: Invited to be a Senior TPC in IJCAI 2021. Oct/2020: Our paper Memory Augmented Hierarchical Attention Network for Next Point-of-Interest Recommendation is accepted by IEEE Trans. on Computational Social Systems with minor revisions. Sep/2020: Our paper Enabling Cost-Effective Population Health Monitoring By Exploiting Spatiotemporal Correlation: An Empirical Study is accepted by ACM Trans. on Computing for Healthcare. We conducted an in-depth study based on 10-year's spatiotemporal morbidity rates of chronic diseases in more than 500 regions of London to verify if spatiotemporal correlations can be leveraged for data inference using only a small number of samples. Sep/2020: Our paper Generalizing Universal Adversarial Attacks Beyond Additive Perturbations is accepted by ICDM 2020, we released our Universal Adversarial Attack tool - GUAP. Sep/2020: Our tutorial proposal on “Adversarial Robustness of Deep Learning Theory, Algorithms, and Applications” is one of four tutorials that are accepted by ICDM 2020. July/2020: Our paper A Survey of Safety and Trustworthiness of Deep Neural Networks: Verification, Testing, Adversarial Attack and Defence, and Interpretability is accepted by Computer Science Review. We conducted a comprehensive survey of the current research effort into making DNNs safe and trustworthy from four aspects: verification, testing, adversarial attack and defence, and interpretability. Feb/2020: Our research was covered by multiple media: Lancaster University News, EurekAlert, ScienceBlog, eScience News, Science X, and Heriot-Watt University News. Feb/2020: Invited by Prof Michael Sheng from Macquarie University, I give a talk about Robustness of Deep Neural Networks in his group. Dec/2019: Invited by Prof Zhi Jin from Peking University, I give a talk about Robustness of Deep Neural Networks at Key Lab of High Confidence Software Technologies, Ministry of Education. Nov/2019: Got a Partnership Resource Fund from ORCA Hub for the project “Towards Accountable and Explainable Learning-enabled Autonomous Robotic Systems”, the overall amount is £180K. Nov/2019: Our paper AdaCare: Explainable Clinical Health Status Representation Learning via Scale-Adaptive Feature Extraction and Recalibration, is accepted by AAAI 2020 with Oral Presentation, our code is released. Nov/2019: Our paper ConCare: Personalized Clinical Feature Embedding via Capturing the Healthcare Context is accepted by AAAI 2020, our code is released. Oct/2019: Got a subcontract from Liverpool University, funded by Defence Science and Technology Laboratory, to work on the project “Test Coverage Metrics for Artificial Intelligence V2”, the overall amount is £15K.
